creator: nico@belcenter.com
text:
Hello,

 I have installed Php with apache..

 When i edit a file , a temp file was created with ~ at the end of the file.

 So when i call xxx.php~ , i have the all codes in my browser !!!
 
 i have found 2 solutions, add the .php~ as php applications or add 
 a files match *~ to deny access. Is it possible to add a function 
 in apache to deny these files to all.. 

 Thanks
 Nico

creator: nd@perlig.de
text:
You may either configure your editor or configure apache to work around these
backup files.
There's no security problem.

<Files *~>
  Order Allow,Deny
  Satisfy All
  Deny from all
</Files>

Is the proper way. No need to try to be more clever than the admin.

Thanks for using Apache.
